Diaspora Cookbook
=================

Installing Diaspora on a server
-------------------------------

Confirmed to work on Ubuntu 10.04.

Get a server or VPS and set up public key authentication for root.
[TODO "for a user that has sudo right"]
[TODO link to a guide]

Do the steps in http://wiki.opscode.com/display/chef/Quick+Start
including
  knife bootstrap yourserver.com -r 'recipe[chef-client]' -x root
  [TODO: knife bootstrap yourserver.com -r 'recipe[chef-client]' -x jim --sudo]

Type `knife node list` to check if the new node is there.

Then run:

  knife cookbook upload diaspora apt build-essential git java mysql apache2 openssl runit
  knife node run_list add NODE 'recipe[diaspora]'

On the server as root:

Stop the chef-client service:

  /etc/init.d/chef-client stop

Run chef-client service manually:

  /usr/bin/ruby1.8 /usr/bin/chef-client -P /var/run/chef/client.pid -l debug -c /etc/chef/client.rb

recipes.diaspora: Sets up all diaspora services on one node

name: diaspora
